page.title: 17POPULATION
page.content: From 1961 to 1976 the{population}of Whitchurch fell by 2% from 7165 to 7010 but by 1983 it had recovered to 7350.Birth and{death rates}plus migration,explain Whitchurch's static population.From 1951 to 1976 the number of people aged 65 plus rose from 923 to 1396,whilst the 45-64 year age group remained stable.The numbers in the 20-44 age group fell from 2329 to 2035 and a similar decrease affected the 0-19 age group.The{birth {rate}in Whitchurch has declined greater than the national average.From 17 per 1000 of the population in 1951, the number of births fell to 14 per 1000 in 1973.Many young Whitchurch people have left to find jobs elsewhere whilst inward{migration}has mostly been by people aged 45 and over.
